attributes.comment:
My husband and I are in the process of adopting a child from the People's
Republic oc China. The burden of having to refile for a valid I-171H is both costly
and emotionally draining for us. We also have to be refingerprinted (extra cost).
An I-171H should be valid for at least two years (we think it should be valid through
bringing our new child home from China. Fingerprints do not change within 15
months. It's not morally right to raise the rates of a new I-600A and fingerprints.
It's bad enough that we have to get new fingerprints and an I 171H, PLEASE do
not raise the rates even higher than what they are right now. Our I-171H and
fingerprints should still be valid as we are not home with our beautiful new child
yet. All of us parents adopting are praying you do not raise the rates, as our old
ones should still be valid. Thank you so much for your attention to this matter.

Scott and Cheryl Davis
Colorado Springs, Colorado
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Cheryl A. Davis
